biography.value:
Orcus is the Demon Prince of Undeath, also known as the Blood Lord. While he takes pleasure in the sufferings of the living, he far prefers the company and service of Undead. His desire is to see all life quenched and the multiverse transformed into a vast necropolis populated solely by Undead creatures under his command.

Orcus rewards those who spread death in his name by granting them a small portion of his power. The least of these become ghoul;ghouls and zombie;zombies (both appear in the Monster Manual) that serve in his legions, while his favored servants are the cultists and necromancers who murder the living and then manipulate the dead, emulating their dread master.

Orcus is a bestial creature of corruption with a diseased, decaying look. He has the lower body of a goat and a humanlike upper body with a belly swollen with rot. Great bat wings sprout from his shoulders, and his head is like the skull of a goat, the flesh nearly rotted from it. In one hand, he wields the legendary Wand of Orcus, which is described in the Dungeon Masterâ€™s Guide.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or &Reference[necrotic]{Necrotic} Bolt attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures &Reference[undead]{Undead} creatures whose combined average hit points donâ€™t exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

At will: detect magic

3/day: dispel magic

1/day: time stop

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save DC 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:

At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead

1 charge each: circle of death, finger of death

2 charges: power word kill

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Orcus can take one of the following lair actions; he canâ€™t take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

Deadly Utterance. Orcusâ€™s voice booms throughout the lair. His utterance causes one creature of his choice to be subjected to power word kill. Orcus neednâ€™t see the creature, but he must be aware that the individual is in the lair.

Grasp of the Dead. Orcus causes skeletal arms to rise from an area on the ground in a 20-foot square that he can see. They last until the next initiative count 20. Each creature in that area when the arms appear must succeed on a [[/save str 23 format=long]] or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} until the arms disappear or until Orcus releases them (no action required).

&Reference[undead]{Undead} Servants. Orcus causes up to six corpses within the lair to rise as skeleton;skeletons, zombie;zombies, or ghoul;ghouls (all appear in the Monster Manual). These &Reference[undead]{Undead} obey his telepathic commands, which can reach anywhere in the lair.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regional Effects

The region containing Orcusâ€™s lair is warped by his magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

Charnel Realm. The air is filled with the stench of rotting flesh, and buzzing flies grow thick within the region.

&Reference[undead]{Undead} Beasts. Dead Beasts periodically animate as &Reference[undead]{Undead} mockeries of their former selves. Skeletal and zombie versions of local wildlife are commonly seen in the area.

If Orcus dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Orcusâ€™s Lair

Orcus makes his lair in the fortress city of Naratyr, which is on Thanatos, the layer of the Abyss that he rules. Surrounded by a moat fed by the River Styx, Naratyr is an eerily quiet and &Reference[cold]{cold} city, its streets empty for hours at a time. The central castle of bone has interior walls of flesh and carpets made of woven hair. The city contains wandering &Reference[undead]{Undead}, many of which are engaged in continuous battles with one another.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Cultists of Orcus

Orcus grants his rank-and-file cultists the Undying Soul trait, and his cult leaders can gain the Aura of Death trait.

Undying Soul (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). If this creature is reduced to 0 hit points, it immediately makes a [[/save con 10 format=long]]. If it succeeds, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point.

Aura of Death. This creature emanates a deathly aura that extends 30 feet in every direction from its space while it isnâ€™t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}. The aura is blocked by total cover. While in the aura, the creature and any friendly &Reference[undead]{Undead} are immune to the &Reference[frightened]{frightened} condition and have resistance to &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage. Enemies have disadvantage on death saving throws while in the aura.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Orcus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatureâ€™s turn. Orcus regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Attack. Orcus makes one Tail or &Reference[necrotic]{Necrotic} Bolt attack.

Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions). Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} of swirling &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcusâ€™s next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

Orcus makes one Tail or &Reference[necrotic]{Necrotic} Bolt attack.

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Master of Undeath. Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create &Reference[undead]{undead} (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create &Reference[undead]{undead} even when it isnâ€™t night.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Special Equipment. Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

description.value:
Special Notes: as an action.

This spell creates an &Reference[undead]{undead} servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an &Reference[undead]{undead} creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional &Reference[undead]{undead} creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

description.value:
Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. The target takes 8d8 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

If you target a &Reference[plant]{plant} creature or a magical &Reference[plant]{plant}, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical &Reference[plant]{plant} that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw; it simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

system.chatFlavor: [8d8 - necrotic] No Effect: undead, construct; Max Damage: plant

description.value:
You grant the semblance of life and &Reference[int]{intelligence} to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be &Reference[undead]{undead}. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

description.value:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook

description.value:
You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take 1d4 + 1 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal.

This spell ends if one of the actions you use during this period, or any effects that you create during this period, affects a creature other than you or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you. In addition, the spell ends if you move to a place more than 1,000 feet from the location where you cast it.

source.book: Playerâ€™s Handbook
